DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Skin Ulcer Size Longest Measurement Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the dimension of the largest ulceration lesion in an individual with chronic Graft vs. Host Disease (GVHD) as measured in centimeters.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Skin Ulcer Size
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The assessment of the transplant recipient for signs and symptoms of chronic Graft versus Host Disease (GVHD)._1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part._A lesion on the surface of the skin or a mucous surface, produced by the sloughing of inflammatory necrotic tissue._A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases.  Onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._Size; the physical magnitude of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A graft versus host disease with symptoms appearing more than 100 days post-transplant.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredDefinition: 1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part.:A lesion on the surface of the skin or a mucous surface, produced by the sloughing of inflammatory necrotic tissue.:Size; the physical magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
A circumscribed inflammatory and often suppurating lesion on the skin or an internal mucous surface resulting in necrosis of tissue.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the primary or longest diameter measurement in millimeters used to calculate the longest bidimensional measurement for a lesion or tumor._Measurement; the size or magnitude of something._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support CCR Transplant study 08C0097.
